description: US officials and their allies are focusing efforts now on ensuring any retaliation from Israel doesn’t raise the stakes too high.
title: Iran’s Attack on Israel Sparks Race to Avert a Full-Blown War

description: Venezuela’s government arrested two high-level energy officials on Sunday following the detention of a former oil minister amid an investigation into billions of lost Petroleos de Venezuela SA revenue.
title: Venezuela Arrests Oil, Gas PDVSA Officials on Graft Probe

description: Chinese business executives and investors are embracing a future fraught with geopolitical tensions and slowing economic growth, but also with opportunity emerging from the country’s burst real estate bubble.
title: Chinese Executives See US-China Rivalry as ‘Biggest Uncertainty’

description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said the US wouldn’t take “anything off the table” in response to China’s manufacturing capacity, including the possibility of additional tariffs to stem what she has described as a flood of cheap goods into the US market.
title: Yellen Says Nothing Off Table in Response to China Overcapacity

description: Poland ordered record cuts for generation of renewable energy on Sunday due to electricity oversupply, highlighting growing challenges the nation’s grid faces from the wider use of green power.
title: Poland Curbs Output From Wind and Solar Farms Amid Oversupply

description: Donald Trump is poised to become the first former US president to face a criminal trial, a watershed moment for American democracy as the Republican nominee fights a divisive battle to retake the White House.
title: Trump’s NY Criminal Trial to Mark Milestone in American Politics

description: Speaker Mike Johnson said the House will vote this week on aid for Israel in the wake of Iran’s attack, and he indicated Ukraine funds could be part of the package.
title: House Plans Israel Aid Vote and May Add on Ukraine, Johnson Says

description: Welcome to a special edition Balance of Power, bringing you the latest on Iran’s attack on Israel. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: The Iran-Israel Shadow War Erupts Into the Open

description: Iran’s weekend attack on Israel with more than 300 missiles and drones marks a perilous turn for a fragile region. It was an unprecedented action, the first strike on the Jewish state from Iranian soil. Iran declared it a massive success.
title: Israel Grapples With New Phase in its Multi-Front War With Iran

description: Like no one before him, Donald Trump is at once a former president, a presumptive candidate to be nominated for the presidency again, and a criminal defendant. He faces 88 felony charges in four separate cases for conduct before, during and after his presidency, including conspiring to defraud the US in his efforts to overturn his 2020 election loss, mishandling classified documents, and falsifying business records to cover up hush money to an adult film actress. This unprecedented situation rai
title: How Trump’s Criminal Cases Test the US Constitution

description: Israel and allies including the US, UK and France managed to mostly foil an unprecedented attack by Iran on the Jewish state.
title: Mideast Enters Dangerous New Phase With Iran’s Attack On Israel

description: Israel said Hamas had rejected the latest cease-fire proposal from mediators, as tensions escalate following Iran’s mostly foiled assault against the Jewish state overnight.
title: Israel Says Hamas Rejected Cease-fire Proposal After Iran Attack

description: Airlines are weighing an ever narrowing set of options to fly between Europe and Asia after grappling with airspace shutdowns in the wake of the first direct Iranian attack on Israel from its soil.
title: Airlines Confront New Iran-Israel Risks as Disruption Grows

description: India’s ruling party pledged to focus on infrastructure and keep popular subsidies in place in its election manifesto as Prime Minister Narendra Modi bids for a historic third term in voting this week.
title: Modi’s Party Vows Growth, Development in Election Manifesto

description: Donald Trump endorsed Republican David McCormick, who is running to represent Pennsylvania in the US Senate, granting the former hedge fund executive a stamp of approval he failed to win the last time he ran for office.
title: Trump Endorses McCormick for Pennsylvania Senate Seat
